IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO MINISTER THE LOVE OF JESUS CHRIST TO THE LEAST, THE LAST, AND THE LOST OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE IN THE AREAS OF GUIDANCE, COUNSELING, EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING,
IRS990.MissionDesc: To minister the love of Jesus Christ
IRS990.Desc: PREVENTION, OUTREACH, AND EMERGENCY SERVICES AND PROGRAMS WE PROVIDE SERVICES TO HOMELESS AND THOSE AT RISK OF HOMELESSNESS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF FOOD, SHELTER AND CLOTHING AS WELL AS ENABLING SERVICES TO HELP THE HOMELESS RETURN TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY. OUR STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WORK TO PROVIDE RESOURCES INCLUDING ENTRANCE INTO OUR SHELTER PROGRAM, CARE COORDINATION, EDUCATION RESOURCES AND FOOD BOXES. OUTREACH SERVICES ARE PROVIDED THROUGH OUR TWO MOBILE CHILI VANS TO PROVIDE MEALS, REFERRALS AND OTHER RESOURCES THROUGHOUT ORANGE COUNTY. EMERGENCY SERVICES ARE DEPLOYED THROUGH LOGISTICS SUPPORT, COMMUNICATIONS, TEMPORARY SHELTER, FOOD AND OTHER RESOURCES TO REPAIR AND REBUILD LIVES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EMERGENCY & TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAMS EMERGENCY SHELTER AND TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAMS ARE PROVIDED AT MULTIPLE CAMPUSES FOR HOMELESS MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN. OUR PROGRAM IS FAITH-FOCUSED AND DESIGNED TO RESTORE HEARTS AND LIVES AND HELP SUPPORT PARTICIPANTS IN REGAINING SELF-SUFFICIENCY. THE TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM INCLUDES SPIRITUAL AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT, CASE MANAGEMENT, COUNSELING SERVICES, MEDICAL AND DENTAL CARE, CAREER COUNSELING, EDUCATION AND JOB TRAINING CLASSES, CREDIT

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: RAPID RE-HOUSING, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, RESTORATIVE COMMUNITIES RAPID REHOUSING AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING PROGRAMS HOUSE FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE HOMELESS OR LIVING IN POVERTY MOTELS. WE PROVIDE LONGER TERM HOUSING FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS TO ALLOW THEM TIME TO STABILIZE THEIR FINANCIAL SITUATION AND BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT. OUR AFFORDABLE HOUSING PROGRAM IS DESIGNED AS THE FINAL PHASE OF TRANSITION FOR SELF-SUFFICIENCY. RESTORATIVE COMMUNITIES FOR HOMELESS VETERANS AND VICTIMS OF HUMAN TRAFFICK

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Orange County Rescue Mission has various pieces of artwork and sculptures and stained glass throughout the Village of Hope (homeless shelter) in Tustin, CA. This art is to inspire beauty and worth to the formerly homeless men, women and children living at this facility.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: To help Santa Rosa residents who lost their homes in the fire.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Jim Palmer, Jewel Loff and Bryan Crain participated in a 457 deferred compensation plan and received matching contributions each of $12,000, $12,000 and $8,250 respectively.
The organization uses a third party to sell donated vehicles.

The BOD annually completes a conflict of interest form and any conflicts of interest are reviewed at a regularly scheduled BOD meeting. If a board member has a conflict of interest regarding an item being voted upon they are recused from the vote.
The BOD annually reviews the compensation of other like non-profits to determine if the compensation for the CEO is reasonable.
